item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Drain is blocked, has been for a while, causes flooding of footpath, 23rd October
item.description:
The drain as marked has been blocked for some time. Also, the adjacent drain outside the CLC HFC entrance is blocked. During rainfall, the overflow floods the footpath and flows down the access road to the Honeybourne path. Pedestrians have to walk in the road to avoid the flooding. These drains have been blocked for months!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Malvern Road, Alstone, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicular access at the top of Gravel Walk is extremely tight, Positioning of the Road name plate at the top right needs to be reviewed, Bank to the top left needs to be reviewed., 23rd October
item.description:
Vehicular access at the top of Gravel Walk is extremely tight and local residents have complained to Southam Patish Council. Following a collision at the top of Gravel Walk, the wall/boundary of Forge Cottage was damaged and road name sign destroyed. When this was repaired the new road sign was installed in the lane, which has reduced access by a couple of inches. It was previously on top of the wall as clearly visible on google maps August 2012) see link; https://maps.app.goo.gl/V6xG3nG34Wmw2trM There is a bank on the left hand side at the top of Gravel Walk which is at the rear of Richmond on Old Road. This is being eroded by vehicle tyres. This needs attention as we believe there is a retaining wall beyond the embankment and Highways need to look at this with the landowner to understand ownership and responsibility for maintenance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Walk, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Significant pothole/subsidence at the top of Gravel Walk, left hand side,, 23rd October
item.description:
I walked down Gravel Walk behind a transit van and the front tyre and then back tyre went down this hole and then back out. It is getting progressively worse and all residents using this lane and their visitors have complained to Southam Parish Council about it and potential damage to vehicles. Please inspect adap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Walk, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole of road, 23rd October
item.description:
The whole of Fairhaven Avenue is a mess, the road doesn’t drain due to the road being uneven and full of holes. The road has been repaired numerous times over the years and does need complete resurfacing. It’s completely unfair that we live in a road so bad that weeds grow against the curbs and is very uneven. The road opposite us has been resurfaced but ours was left full of cracks and potholes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Fairhaven Avenue, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
